trip.pageTitle: Sep 1981 - Kath and Jim - on the road
trip.pageSubtitle: A Drive-away car - 7 days to Portland and hitch back (almost)
trip.introDescr: Kathy and I took a very quick trip from Chicago to Portland in a little old ladies 1979 Cutlass and then I hitched back to Denver. Under the driveaway rules we had seven days to get from Chicago to Portland and drop the car off.  Our plan was to then spend a week in Oregon with Aaron and then Kathy would fly home to NJ and I would hitchhike back to Chicago

adventureDay.pdesc: We picked up the car outside Chicago and drove straight thru to Denver.  After an overnight at the Coriano's we headed over the Divide and stopped at Cooper Mtn for a hike.  We ended the day in Steamboat Springs where we watch the original Indiana Jones movie at the local movie theatre.

adventureDay.h1title: Jackson Hole and Grand Tetons NP
adventureDay.pdesc: The next day we were on to Jackson Hole, WY and Grand Tetons NP.  We stayed in a platform tent with a pull down bed.  This was a bad idea and we had one of the coldest night sleeps ever.  The next day we went horseback riding in the park before on to Portland

adventureDay.h3: 3 days, 4-5 hours sleep and Grandma comes to the rescue
adventureDay.pdesc: Aaron dropped me off about an hour south of Portland on I5 at around noon.  I stood for the next 12 hours before attempting to sleep.  This didnt work so back on the highway i went.  About 2am a guy pulled over and offered a ride if I could drive which I  gladly accepted.  We drove down to just north of Sacramento where I5 and I80 intersect.  I've now been up for 24hrs.  I had a few miile walk to get to a place where the eastbound traffic from I5 south would pass me and eventually I got a ride to just outside Reno, NV.  From there I got a ride from a man in a pickup who explained that the buckshot in his 38 revolver would rip my face off if I tried anything.  Things got better from there.  The good news was he was going all the way across Nevada.  He left me in Elko, NV sometime in the afternoon.  Looking at the map and the remaining stretch of desert
